projectPurpose: To serve as a companion code repository for a Rust programming course on the Geektime online education platform, providing practical code examples and exercises.
mainFeatures: Code examples aligned with a specific Rust course curriculum

alternatives.name: The Rust Programming Language ("The Book")
mainFeatures: Covers core concepts and advanced topics

alternatives.name: Rust by Example
mainFeatures: Learn Rust through runnable code examples
Covers various language features and standard library

alternatives.name: Rustlings
mainFeatures: Interactive learning via small coding exercises
Helps users get familiar with Rust syntax and concepts
Includes a watch mode for guided progress

alternatives.name: Online Courses (Udemy, Coursera, etc.)
mainFeatures: Often cover specific Rust application areas (e.g., web dev)

marketPositioning: geektime-rust is positioned as a supplementary resource specifically for students enrolled in a commercial Rust programming course on the Geektime platform. Unlike general, freely available Rust learning resources such as The Rust Programming Language book, Rust by Example, or Rustlings, which serve a broad audience of Rust learners, this repository's primary value lies in its direct correlation with the specific curriculum and teaching style of the accompanying paid course. It is a code companion designed to be used in conjunction with the course content, rather than a standalone learning tool.
